Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 21st overall pick, by Los Angeles in 1969...
Traded from Los Angeles to Minnesota on 7/7/1969 (Going to LA: SS D. Campbell. Going to MIN: CF M. Rivers, C T. Simmons, RF R. Zisk)...
Injured on 7/12/1971 with a Inflamed Hip Muscle, out for 5 days...
Had first career hit on 4/2/1972, off Dave Bennett (OAK)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/11/1972, off Don Sutton (OAK)...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Cleveland on 9/4/1975...
Traded from Minnesota to San Francisco on 7/14/1977 (Going to SF: P D. Lewallyn, P M. Fidrych, SS R. Washington, LF L. Fritz, LF M. Rivers. Going to MIN: 1B B. Robertson)...
Injured on 9/25/1982 with a Bruised Jaw, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1982...
Injured on 6/18/1983 with a Bruised Ulna, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1983...
